alert.note: Alert for Polk (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 8:09PM CDT until July 28 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Polk County in northwestern Wisconsin... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 809 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Osceola, St. Croix Falls, Luck, Balsam Lake, Taylors Falls, Centuria, Milltown, Dresser, Straight Lake Wilderness State Park, Osceola Airport and Wild River State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
